thread.title: Ramblers Worldwide Holidays: terms and conditions
thread.title_full: Ramblers Worldwide Holidays: terms and conditions - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Ramblers Worldwide Holidays: terms and conditions
text: 1. This prize draw is open to residents of the UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and Republic of Ireland aged 18 years or over, except employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and its group companies (“Promoter”), and Ramblers Holidays Limited, their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. Entries must be submitted via www.ramblersholidays.co.uk and entry is restricted to one per person. Once submitted, entries cannot be amended in any way. 4. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. The winner will be drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date. The winner’s name and county can be obtained by sending a sae to Ramblers Worldwide Holidays Winner, SPARK , Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month after the closing date of the prize draw. 5. All entries must be received by midnight on Monday 30 November 2015. 6. The winner will be contacted by midnight on 31 December 2015. Should the Promoter be unable to contact the winner or should the winner be unable to accept the prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award the prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. 7. The prize as described is available on the date of publication. Should the prize become unavailable, a substitute of equal value shall be provided. 8. The winning entrant will win a seven night walking holiday for two people on the Buttermere shore at Lake District The prize package comprises: • Seven night accommodation in a twin room at Hassness Country House, Buttermere Valley, Cockermouth CA13 9XA. Full board including: daily breakfast; lunch is provided on the walking days; and daily dinner provided save for Tuesdays. • A walking programme of daily guided group walks. • The services of an experienced walk leader. 9. The grade of the walking programme will vary each week. The winner will be offered the choice of a weekly walking programme that suits their ability. 10. The prize must be taken as one package. 11. The prize does not include: travel; travel to or from the accommodation; transfers; personal expenditure; footwear; or clothing. 12. The prize is valid to be taken before 31 October 2016. Ramblers Worldwide Holidays standard terms and conditions apply which can be found at http://www.ramblersholidays.co.uk/uploadDocuments/TCRCW-Live.pdf 13. All elements of the prize are subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 14. The winner may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of the Promoter and Ramblers Holidays Limited. 15. Entrants’ data will be used for the purpose of administration of this prize draw and in accordance with the permissions granted or withheld at the point of entry. 16. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prize impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter and accordingly the Promoter may at its absolute discretion vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. 17. The Telegraph is responsible for the first part of the promotion, which is the publication and adjudication of the prize draw. Provision of the prize is the responsibility Ramblers Limited. 18. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT.
